Info:
Involves the excavation and removal of soil to create profile boxes, 
a crucial step in archaeological site analysis. 
This task can involve moving up to 2 cubic meters of soil.

Entails the meticulous cleaning of profiles and plans, 
requiring a delicate touch to ensure the preservation of artifacts. 
This step is essential for detailed documentation and analysis.

Involves creating detailed illustrations of archaeological features in both plan and profile views. 
This requires patience and a keen eye to accurately depict stratigraphic layers and other significant details.

Involves coordinating the excavation team, managing schedules, and handling administrative tasks, 
including communication with heritage preservation authorities. 
Requires strong organizational skills and professional knowledge.

Involves the precise documentation of findings through photography and surveying, 
crucial for creating accurate excavation maps. 
Requires technical proficiency with photographic and surveying equipment.

Responsible for maintaining up-to-date excavation records, overseeing ongoing tasks, 
and describing and dating finds when possible. 
This role requires extensive professional knowledge to ensure accurate and comprehensive documentation.
